org.dsa.iot.dslink.node

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dsa.iot.dslink.node.Node
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    NodeManager.SuperRoot

    public class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains information about a node and its data.

    • Constructor Summary

        parent - Parent of this node
        link - Linkable class the node is handled on

        Returns:

      • createChild

        public NodeBuilder createChild(java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.String profile)
        Creates a node builder to allow setting up the node data before any list subscriptions can be notified.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the child.
        profile - Profile to set on the child
        Returns:
        builder
        See Also:
        NodeBuilder.build()

      • addChild

        public Node addChild(Node node)
        The child will be added if the node doesn't exist. If the child already exists then it will be returned and no new node will be created. This can be used as a special getter.
        Parameters:
        node - Child node to add.
        Returns:
        The node

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Deletes this node from its parent.

        Parameters:
        node - Node to remove.
        Returns:
        The node if it existed.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The node if it existed.

        Parameters:
        name - Name of the child.
        Returns:
        Whether this node has the child or not.

      • clearConfigs

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Value> clearConfigs()
        Clears all the configurations from the node.
        Returns:
        All the previous configurations.

      • setConfig

        public Value setConfig(java.lang.String name,
                       Value value)
        The name will be checked for validity. Certain names that are set through other APIs cannot be set here, otherwise it will throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the configuration
        value - Value to set
        Returns:
        The previous configuration value, if any
        See Also:
        Action

        Removes a read-only configuration.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the configuration.
        Returns:
        Previous value of the configuration, if any.

      • clearRoConfigs

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Value> clearRoConfigs()
        Clears all the read-only configurations from the node.
        Returns:
        All the previous read-only configurations.

        Retrieves a read-only configuration.

      • getAction

        public Action getAction()
        Returns:
        Action this node can invoke

      • setAction

        public void setAction(Action action)
        Sets the action of the node.
        Parameters:
        action - Action to set. Use null to remove an action.

      • getPassword

        public char[] getPassword()
        Gets the password the node is configured to use. This is necessary for authentication to servers.
        Returns:
        Password the node is configured to use.

      • setPassword

        public void setPassword(char[] password)
        If this node accesses servers and requires authentication, the password must be set here. This will censor the password from being retrieved through the responder.
        Parameters:
        password - Password to set.

      • setHasChildren

        public void setHasChildren(java.lang.Boolean hasChildren)
        Forcibly sets whether the node has children or not. This does NOT affect whether the node has children internally.
        Parameters:
        hasChildren - Whether the node hsa children or not.

      • getHasChildren

        public java.lang.Boolean getHasChildren()
        Checks whether the node is forced to have children or not. This does NOT check if the node has children internally. To check whether the node has children internally, use getChildren().
        Returns:
        Whether the node has children or not.

      • setHidden

        public void setHidden(boolean hidden)
        Parameters:
        hidden - Whether the node is marked as hidden.

      • isHidden

        public boolean isHidden()
        When a node is marked as hidden the UI should not display the node.
        Returns:
        Whether the node is marked as hidden.

      • createFakeBuilder

        public NodeBuilder createFakeBuilder()
        Creates a fake node builder that wraps its methods around this node. This allows fitting a Node into a NodeBuilder when necessary.
        Returns:
        A fake node builder.

      • isSerializable

        public boolean isSerializable()
        If this node is not serializable, none of the children will be either by default.
        Returns:
        Whether this node should be serialized or not

      • setSerializable

        public void setSerializable(boolean serializable)
        Sets whether this node and its children should be serialized.
        Parameters:
        serializable - Whether this node can be serialized.

      • setMetaData

        public void setMetaData(java.lang.Object object)
        Sets the meta data of the node. Used for attaching extra information to a node. This meta data is not serialized. The sole purpose of meta data is to attach a custom instance that operates on this node.
        Parameters:
        object - Meta data object.

      • getMetaData

        public <T> T getMetaData()
        Type Parameters:
        T - Meta data to cast to.
        Returns:
        The attached meta data of this node.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the node's exposed data.

      • checkAndEncodeName

        public static java.lang.String checkAndEncodeName(java.lang.String name)
        Checks the string and then returns it. An exception is thrown if the name is invalid in any way.
        Parameters:
        name - Name to check
        Returns:
        Name

      • getBannedCharacters

        public static char[] getBannedCharacters()
        Returns:
        The banned characters not allowed to be in names.
